meanings.definition: The amount of liquid that a container can hold.
meanings.sent1: The innage of the cup was just enough to quench my thirst.
meanings.sent2: She poured the water until the innage reached the brim of the glass.
meanings.sent3: The innage of the bottle seemed to magically refill every time I emptied it.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held an innage of tears, ready to spill at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The innage of the lake reflected the colors of the sunset beautifully.

meanings.definition: The act of measuring the depth of a liquid in a container.
meanings.sent1: The innage of the pool was checked before the swimming competition.
meanings.sent2: He used a ruler to determine the innage of the oil in the jar.
meanings.sent3: The innage of the bathtub was mistakenly measured with a tape measure.
meanings.sent4: She dove into the pool, disappearing into the innage of the water.
meanings.sent5: The innage of the river was carefully monitored during the dry season.
